title: Alternative medicine | Life and style | The Guardian
cleaned_text: Alternative medicine - Exclusive: experts fear the cost-of-living crisis is forcing people to forgo evidence-based healthcare [Woolworths' free naturopath consultations raise concerns among peak health bodies](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/aug/28/woolworths-free-naturopath-consultations-raises-concerns-among-peak-health-bodies) - Joe Hinchliffe speaks to Jane Lee about two deaths involving a frog toxin called kamboPodcast [The deaths shining a light on ritual poison therapies - Full Story podcast](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/audio/2023/may/24/the-deaths-shining-a-light-on-alternative-therapies-full-story-podcast) - Two weeks of harrowing testimony at consecutive inquests shines a light on the northern rivers' alternative therapy scene [Alternative reality: two in Australia's counter-culture capital](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/may/13/alternative-reality-two-kambo-deaths-spark-soul-searching-in-australias-counter-culture-capital) - ['Galling': family of man who died after frog toxin ceremony criticise alleged comments of retreat organiser at NSW inquest](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/may/12/galling-family-of-man-who-died-after-frog-toxin-ceremony-criticise-alleged-comments-of-retreat-organiser-at-nsw-inquest)To hear death of Jarrad Antonovich described as 'beautiful' was 'particularly galling', brother tells court ['Galling': family of man who died after frog toxin ceremony criticise alleged comments of retreat organiser at NSW inquest](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/may/12/galling-family-of-man-who-died-after-frog-toxin-ceremony-criticise-alleged-comments-of-retreat-organiser-at-nsw-inquest) - Dentist tells coroner he heard the laboured breathing of a visibly unwell man in the silence between songs ['Guardians' told Ayahuasca ceremony participants to ignore dying man, NSW inquest told](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/may/11/guardians-told-ayahuasca-ceremony-participants-to-ignore-dying-man-nsw-inquest-told) - Princess Märtha Louise will focus on alternative medicine alongside spiritual guru Durek Verrett [Norwegian princess quits royal duties to work with 'shaman' fiance](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/nov/08/norwegian-princess-quits-royal-duties-work-shaman-fiance-martha-louise) - [Blackmores subsidiary kept selling pregnancy vitamins despite hundreds of complaints, ex-employee alleges](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2022/aug/09/blackmores-subsidiary-kept-selling-pregnancy-vitamins-despite-hundreds-of-complaints-ex-employee-alleges)Whistleblower says he was instructed to tell customers the products were safe to consume, despite lack of testing evidence [Blackmores subsidiary kept selling pregnancy vitamins despite hundreds of complaints, ex-employee alleges](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2022/aug/09/blackmores-subsidiary-kept-selling-pregnancy-vitamins-despite-hundreds-of-complaints-ex-employee-alleges) - Exclusive: Tory leadership candidate has voiced support for what others say is bogus treatment [Penny Mordaunt repeatedly advocated use of homeopathy on NHS](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2022/jul/15/penny-mordaunt-repeatedly-advocated-use-of-homeopathy-on-nhs) - A pioneering surgery in Brighton is pushing the boundaries of what patients can expect, offering dance classes, art and foraging. Dr Laura Marshall-Andrews tells Eva Wiseman why her approach helps people - and the NHS [Better ways to get better: the radical GP changing lives](https://www.theguardian.com/society/2022/jun/26/better-ways-to-get-better-the-radical-gp-changing-lives) - Clinical trials show that curcumin, present in the spice, may help fight osteoarthritis and other diseases, but there's a catch - bioavailability, or how to get it into the blood [Does turmeric's reputation translate into real health benefits?](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2022/may/22/does-turmerics-reputation-translate-into-real-health-benefits) - From the cavernous shops in Souq El Blat, herbalists share the rich and fascinating history of their proud and ancient trade - and their fears that it could disappear [The herbalists of Tunis medina: on borrowed thyme - a photo essay](https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2022/feb/16/the-herbalists-of-tunis-medina-on-borrowed-thyme-a-photo-essay) - Some of what is on sale is total bunkum. Some is an easy way to spoil your pooch. And some is slightly more complicated ... [Wellness for dogs: why your pet needs vaccines but not reiki and raw meat](https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2021/dec/24/wellness-for-dogs-why-your-pet-needs-vaccines-but-not-reiki-and-raw-meat) - Tribunal hears Simon Floreani also screened an antivax movie in his clinic and participated in an interview called 'Nazi vaccine regime in Australia' [Victorian chiropractor suspended for six months after linking childhood vaccination to poison](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2021/sep/23/victorian-chiropractor-suspended-for-six-months-after-linking-childhood-vaccination-to-poison) - Pair allegedly charged €150 for 'ancestral' ceremonies involving psychotropic substances
